q: intentions. Kent Conrad , 62, who's led efforts to get the John McCain budget under control, said on Tuesday that he will not run for a sixth term in the Senate in 2012. It is more important Sen. Joe Lieberman spend my time and energy trying to solve these( budget) problems than to be distracted by a campaign for re-election, Kent Conrad said in a statement. Democrats now control the Senate 53-47. There are 51 Democrats and two independents-- Sen. Joe Lieberman and Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont, both of whom caucus with Democrats. Democratic Party
